definition: to make a mess/to mess with/to be wild/to sleep around/to jump into bed
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
to do/to make/to go in for/to set up/to get hold of/to take care of
to be promiscuous/to sleep around
pinyin: luan4 gao3 nan2 nu:3 guan1 xi4

sentences.english: He's always playing about with other men's wives.
sentences.chinese: 他經常與別人的妻子亂搞。

sentences.english: Every day, I wake up, and I'm f—ked up.
sentences.chinese: 每一天，我醒來，然後我操，就是他媽亂搞。

sentences.english: You can double date and mess with your ex-girlfriend's best friend.
sentences.chinese: 你可以腳踏兩隻船，跟你前女友的最好的朋友亂搞。

sentences.english: Sex is the solution to all of the bonobos’ problems.
sentences.chinese: 亂搞是倭黑猩猩解決一切問題的靈丹妙藥。

sentences.english: Boinking the lawyer is just icing on the cake.
sentences.chinese: 跟律師亂搞不過是表面文章而已。

sentences.english: I hear you've been messing with married women in spite of my advice.
sentences.chinese: 我聽說你竟不顧我的忠告和有夫之婦亂搞男女關係。

sentences.english: Don't mess about with married women,it's unlawful.
sentences.chinese: 不要和有夫之婦亂搞男女關係，這樣做是違法的。

sentences.english: Don't fool about with another man's wife.
I think he is in fucks it.
sentences.chinese: 俺覺得他就是在亂搞嗎。

definition: to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
paying more attention to a lover than friends (idiom)/to value sex over friendship
to mix/to blend/(fig.) to spoil/to mess up things/to run around with (sb)/to get involved with/to mix (with other people)
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to act recklessly/to mess around
personal attack
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
Huili county in Liangshan Yi autonomous prefecture 涼山彞族自治州|凉山彝族自治州[Liang2 shan1 Yi2 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], south Sichuan
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
damn thing/(not one's) goddamn business
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
sneering/sarcasm/cynical remarks
sexual relations/sexual contact/intercourse
clean-living and honest (idiom); to avoid immorality/to shun evil influence/to mind one's own business and keep out of trouble/to keep one's hands clean
lit. find a stage, put on a comedy (idiom); to join in the fun/to play along according to local conditions
